Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

Spend_CategoryObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: This is the reference id value of the spend  category. A spend category is a classification of items and services that drive the accounting. All expense items are associated with a Spend Category and sales items are associated with a Revenue Category.If a value is provided for sales item, revenue category will default so it is recommended to provide a value for either sales item or revenue category but not both. It is required if sales item is blank.

validation.validation: Invalid Spend Category. This spend category cannot be tracked in Business Assets
Invalid Spend Category. This spend category is intangible and composite assets must be tangible.
For a Spend Category of Leased, you must specify Leased for the Acquisition Method.

Accounting_TreatmentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Accounting_TreatmentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Accounting_TreatmentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: This is the reference id value to an existing accounting treatment. Workday supplies the accounting treatments Expense, Depreciable Capital and Non-Depreciable Capital. If you don't enter a value, Workday will default accounting treatment from the Business Asset Accounting Rules based on the values from Company, Spend Category and Cost of asset.

validation.validation: Depreciation Profile override is required if Accounting Treatment is Depreciable Capital.
Accounting Treatment must be depreciable capital for intangible spend categories
Invalid accounting treatment.  Accounting treatment cannot be Expense for composite assets that do not specify discrete component lifecycles.
Composite assets using discrete component lifecycles can only have a Non-Depreciable accounting treatment.
Accounting Treatment is required for Non-Discrete Composite Asset. Valid values are either Depreciable Capital Asset or Non-depreciable Capital Asset.
Select a valid accounting treatment. The Inventory Asset accounting treatment isn’t valid for assets.
Auto Complete Option must be set to True (1 or 'y') if the asset accounting treatment is not Expense

validation.validation: Acquisition method is invalid. You cannot assign Intercompany Transfer to Acquisition Method.
validation.description: Acquisition method is invalid. You cannot assign Intercompany Transfer to Acquisition Method.

validation.validation: If one or more components are present, the acquisition method must be COMPOSED and if acquisition method is COMPOSED, there must be components present.
validation.description: If one or more components are present, the acquisition method must be COMPOSED and if acquisition method is COMPOSED, there must be components present.

validation.validation: For an Acquisition Method Leased, you must specify Leased for the Spend Category.

validation.validation: Acquisition Cost cannot have more than 15 integer values.
Unit Cost is not allowed for composite assets as it is derived from component data or zero for discrete lifecycle components.

validation.validation: Residual value cannot be greater than acquisition (unit) cost.
validation.description: Residual value cannot be greater than acquisition (unit) cost.

validation.validation: Residual value cannot be less than acquisition (unit) cost.

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: One or more of the worktags selected are of an invalid type for this transaction.
Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.
validation.description: Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.

validation.validation: Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
[missing worktags for spend, item and location]
[non-allowed worktags for spend, item and location]
'[worktag value]' is not permitted as an allowed value for worktag type: [worktag type] because it is inactive.
[partitionable] is not allowed to be used by [company].
[invalid worktag value message]

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: Date field indicating when the Business Asset was acquired

validation.validation: Ledger Period must exist for the Date Acquired.
validation.description: Ledger Period must exist for the Date Acquired.

validation.validation: Date Placed in Service is required when Depreciation Start Date is entered
validation.description: Date Placed in Service is required when Depreciation Start Date is entered

validation.validation: Ledger Period must exist for the Date Placed in Service.
validation.description: Ledger Period must exist for the Date Placed in Service.

validation.validation: Date Placed in Service must equal the Date Acquired if depreciation starts based on acquisition. If you leave this date blank, Workday will default it for you.
validation.description: Date Placed in Service must equal the Date Acquired if depreciation starts based on acquisition. If you leave this date blank, Workday will default it for you.

validation.validation: Submit a Place in Service Date on or between the asset's Acquisition Date and today
validation.description: Submit a Place in Service Date on or between the asset's Acquisition Date and today

validation.validation: Last Issued Date cannot be less than Date Acquired
validation.description: Last Issued Date cannot be less than Date Acquired

validation.validation: Cost Center: [cost center] is not allowed for Company: [company]
validation.description: If the cost center is restricted to a company, then the company on the asset must match the company on the cost center.

Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Reference to an existing depreciation profile for this depreciation schedule. This value may be overridden for the primary book.

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Reference to an existing Depreciation Method.  Depreciation Methods are provided by Workday and include STRAIGHT_LINE,  DECLINING_BALANCE_SW_SL, and SUM_OF_YEARS_DIGITS. This field defaults from the spend category but can be entered.

validation.validation: Auto Complete Option must be set to True (1 or 'y') if asset conversion data or depreciation schedule override information is provided.
The selected Depreciation Convention can't be used with a depreciation method of [Depreciation Method].

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Depreciation percent for Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line (DECLINING_BALANCE_SW_SL) method. Enter 200 for Double Declining. This field defaults from the spend category depreciation profile but can be entered.

validation.validation: Depreciation percent must be 0 when depreciation method is 'Term'. Make sure that depreciation profile for the asset is setup with depreciation percent of 0.
Depreciation percent should be greater than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance with switch to Straight Line.
validation.description: Depreciation percent should be greater than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance with switch to Straight Line.

validation.validation: Depreciation Percent cannot be entered if Depreciation Method is not Declining Balance (with or without Switch to Straight Line).
validation.description: Depreciation Percent cannot be entered if Depreciation Method is not Declining Balance (with or without Switch to Straight Line).

validation.validation: Depreciation percent must be greater than 0 and less than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance.
validation.description: Depreciation percent must be greater than 0 and less than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance.

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Numeric value representing the useful life (in periods) for the business asset. This field defaults from Spend Category Depreciation Profile but can be entered

validation.validation: Useful Life cannot be more than 200 years. Useful life in years is useful life in periods divided by number of periods in the company's fiscal year.
validation.description: Useful Life cannot be more than 200 years. Useful life in years is useful life in periods divided by number of periods in the company's fiscal year.

validation.validation: Useful life must be 0 when depreciation method is 'Term'. Make sure that depreciation profile for the asset is setup with useful life of 0.
Useful Life must be equal to zero if the Depreciation Method is Declining Balance.
validation.description: Useful Life must be equal to zero if the Depreciation Method is Declining Balance.

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Depreciation Threshold. Enter only if method is declining balance.

validation.validation: Depreciation Threshold is greater than Total Asset Cost.
validation.description: Depreciation Threshold is greater than Total Asset Cost.

validation.validation: Only Declining Balance Depreciation Method can have a threshold.
validation.description: Only Declining Balance Depreciation Method can have a threshold.

validation.validation: Depreciation Threshold is greater than Total Asset Cost.
validation.description: Depreciation Threshold is greater than Total Asset Cost.

validation.validation: Depreciation Threshold is less than Total Asset Cost.
Depreciation Threshold is less than Total Asset Cost.
Depreciation Threshold cannot be positive.
Depreciation Threshold cannot be negative.

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: For converted assets, the depreciation start date represents the date that depreciation starts in Workday. For converted assets with historical accumulated depreciation, the depreciation start date should be 1 day greater than the date up to which the historical accumulated depreciation is calculated. The date cannot be prior to the acquisition date. For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

validation.validation: Depreciation Start Date is required when Remaining Periods is provided
validation.description: Depreciation Start Date is required when Remaining Periods is provided

validation.validation: Depreciation Start Date is required when Accumulated Depreciation is provided
validation.description: Depreciation Start Date is required when Accumulated Depreciation is provided

validation.validation: Ledger Period must exist for the Depreciation Start Date.
validation.description: Ledger Period must exist for the Depreciation Start Date.

validation.validation: For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.
validation.description: For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

validation.validation: Depreciation Start Date must match start date of the first ledger period that depreciation is to start being recorded in Workday.
validation.description: Depreciation Start Date must match start date of the first ledger period that depreciation is to start being recorded in Workday.

validation.validation: Depreciation start date cannot be prior to contract end date unless the asset is loaded as fully depreciated.
validation.description: Depreciation start date cannot be prior to contract end date unless the asset is loaded as fully depreciated.

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Numeric value for remaining depreciation periods if entering accumulated depreciation from a prior system.

validation.validation: Remaining depreciation periods must be 0 when depreciation method is Term or Declining Balance.
validation.description: Remaining depreciation periods must be 0 when depreciation method is Term or Declining Balance.

validation.validation: Remaining depreciation periods is required when you enter Accumulated Depreciation
validation.description: Remaining depreciation periods is required when you enter Accumulated Depreciation

validation.validation: Remaining Depreciation Periods cannot be greater than useful life in periods provided or defaulted from profile for spend category
validation.description: Remaining Depreciation Periods cannot be greater than useful life in periods provided or defaulted from profile for spend category

validation.validation: Accumulated Depreciation cannot be greater than Acquisition Cost minus Residual Value
validation.description: Accumulated Depreciation cannot be greater than Acquisition Cost minus Residual Value

validation.validation: The accumulated depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The accumulated depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: Accumulated Depreciation cannot be negative.
Accumulated Depreciation cannot be positive.
Accumulated Depreciation cannot be less than Acquisition Cost minus Residual Value

Asset_Book_Configuration_WWS_Data.description: Year To Date depreciation as of the Depreciation Start Date. Enter only if method is declining balance or sum of years digits.

validation.validation: The year to date depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The year to date depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: Year To Date Depreciation is required when method is Declining Balance (with or without switch to Straight Line) or Sum Of Years Digits and Depreciation Start Date is not in the first period.
validation.description: Year To Date Depreciation is required when method is Declining Balance (with or without switch to Straight Line) or Sum Of Years Digits and Depreciation Start Date is not in the first period.

validation.validation: Year to Date Depreciation cannot be positive.
Year to Date Depreciation cannot be negative.

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: Depreciation schedule information to use to generate depreciation lines for an asset

validation.validation: Declining Balance Depreciation Method must have a threshold.
validation.description: Declining Balance Depreciation Method must have a threshold.

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: This attribute  is used to identify the type of Composite Asset. When it is checked, life cycle events happen for each Component independently. When it is unchecked, life cycle events happen on the Composite asset only.

Component_Asset_WWS_Data.description: Asset ID of asset used to compose the asset being registered.

validation.validation: The company of each component asset must match the company of the asset being registered/composed.
validation.description: The company of each component asset must match the company of the asset being registered/composed.

validation.validation: Component assets used to create a composite asset must be tangible.
validation.description: Component assets used to create a composite asset must be tangible.

validation.validation: Component assets used to create a composite asset must be trackable.
validation.description: Component assets used to create a composite asset must be trackable.

validation.validation: Component assets used to create a composite asset must have a status of "Registered" or if discrete lifecycles option is selected, statuses of In Service, Issued and Out of Service are allowed.
validation.description: Component assets used to create a composite asset must have a status of "Registered" or if discrete lifecycles option is selected, statuses of In Service, Issued and Out of Service are allowed.

validation.validation: Component assets used to create a composite asset cannot have an in progress event.
validation.description: Component assets used to create a composite asset cannot have an in progress event.

validation.validation: Component assets used to create a composite asset must have accounting assigned.
validation.description: Component assets used to create a composite asset must have accounting assigned.

validation.validation: Component assets used to create a composite asset cannot have Accounting Treatment of Expense unless they are for a composite asset with discrete component lifecycles.
validation.description: Component assets used to create a composite asset cannot have Accounting Treatment of Expense unless they are for a composite asset with discrete component lifecycles.

validation.validation: Composite Asset cannot be composed with other composite assets.
validation.description: Composite Asset cannot be composed with other composite assets.

validation.validation: You cannot select an Asset that has residual value for a non-discrete composite asset.
validation.description: You cannot select an Asset that has residual value for a non-discrete composite asset.

validation.validation: Lease asset cannot be used as a component asset

Component_Asset_WWS_Data.description: Quantity of the referenced component asset to be used in the composition of the registered asset.

validation.validation: The quantity that is selected must be less than or equal to the available quantity of the asset.
validation.description: The quantity that is selected must be less than or equal to the available quantity of the asset.

validation.validation: A selected component asset should have a selected quantity greater than 0.
validation.description: A selected component asset should have a selected quantity greater than 0.

validation.validation: The quantity selected must be equal to the total approved quantity and the total available quantity must be equal to the total approved quantity  when Discrete Component Lifecycles is selected.
validation.description: The quantity selected must be equal to the total approved quantity and the total available quantity must be equal to the total approved quantity  when Discrete Component Lifecycles is selected.

Business_Asset_for_Register_WWS_Data.description: Represents a component (asset and quantity) to be used in composing the asset being registered.  Components selected must have a quantity available, must not be Expense and for Discrete Composite Lifecycles must be non-Depreciable.  Components must have accounting assigned and must not be a part of another composite asset that has a pending registration event.

validation.validation: Any given asset id can be used only once in a composed asset.  If more than one is required, adjust the quantity on the single component reference.
validation.description: Any given asset id can be used only once in a composed asset.  If more than one is required, adjust the quantity on the single component reference.

validation.validation: Cannot have an Employee Worktag along with a Contingent Worker Worktag for the same line.
validation.description: Cannot have an Employee Worktag along with a Contingent Worker Worktag for the same line.

validation.validation: Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.
validation.description: Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.

validation.validation: Can not have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.
validation.description: Can not have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.

validation.validation: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the accounting setup for this asset, you will first need to create additional fiscal years / periods for the fiscal schedule of this asset's company.
validation.description: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the accounting setup for this asset, you will first need to create additional fiscal years / periods for the fiscal schedule of this asset's company.

validation.validation: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the depreciation setup for this asset and create the depreciation schedule, you will need to create additional fiscal years / periods for fiscal schedule linked to the company asset book(s).
validation.description: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the depreciation setup for this asset and create the depreciation schedule, you will need to create additional fiscal years / periods for fiscal schedule linked to the company asset book(s).

validation.validation: Depreciation information cannot be provided for an expensed asset.
validation.description: Depreciation information cannot be provided for an expensed asset.

validation.validation: Contract start date must have same value as Date Acquired
validation.description: Contract start date must have same value as Date Acquired

validation.validation: Contract End Date cannot be before the date an asset is acquired.
validation.description: Contract End Date cannot be before the date an asset is acquired.

validation.validation: Contract End Date cannot be before the Contract Start Date.
validation.description: Contract End Date cannot be before the Contract Start Date.

validation.validation: PO Number, Contract Number, and Project Number are mutually exclusive and can only be entered one at a time.
validation.description: PO Number, Contract Number, and Project Number are mutually exclusive and can only be entered one at a time.

validation.validation: Contract Start and End Date becomes not enterable if a PO or Project Number is entered.
validation.description: Contract Start and End Date becomes not enterable if a PO or Project Number is entered.

validation.validation: When a Project Number is entered, the PO, supplier invoice, receipt, supplier contract number, and contract dates become not enterable.
validation.description: When a Project Number is entered, the PO, supplier invoice, receipt, supplier contract number, and contract dates become not enterable.

validation.validation: Composite assets may not reference a Purchase Order, Contract, Receipt, Invoice or Project.
validation.description: Composite assets may not reference a Purchase Order, Contract, Receipt, Invoice or Project.

validation.validation: Existing assets cannot have component data updated.
validation.description: Existing assets cannot have component data updated.

validation.validation: Quantity for a Composite Asset must be 1
validation.description: Quantity for a Composite Asset must be 1

validation.validation: If an asset is not fully depreciated in all books before the first period in the fiscal calendar, all fiscal periods must be defined starting from the earliest depreciation start date or from the acquisition date if the asset is placed in service upon acquisition.
Contract start date and contract end date are required for selected depreciation method.
